criterion: Lists brand-name anti-nausea medications without mentioning their specific uses or indications.
Provides a clear and concise explanation of how each brand-name anti-nausea medication works to reduce nausea and vomiting.
Does not suggest seeking medical attention or consultation with a healthcare professional for personalized advice.
Lists brand-name anti-nausea medications that are not commonly used or recognized in the medical field.
Asks the user to clarify their request or provides alternative anti-nausea medication options based on their specific needs.
Includes a warning or caution about potential side effects or interactions with other medications for each listed brand-name anti-nausea medication.
Does not mention the importance of consulting a healthcare professional before starting any new medication, including anti-nausea medications.
Provides a detailed explanation of the scientific mechanism behind how each brand-name anti-nausea medication works to reduce nausea and vomiting.
Does not recommend a specific brand-name anti-nausea medication based on the user's request or medical condition.
Includes a list of non-brand-name anti-nausea medications that are available over-the-counter or by prescription.
Provides a clear and concise summary of the key points about brand-name anti-nausea medications.
Does not mention any potential interactions or contraindications between brand-name anti-nausea medications and other medications the user may be taking.
